transportAdvice: Moab is a small desert town where most visitor activity centers around driving to trailheads and park entrances, as public transit is very limited and does not reliably cover the surrounding national parks; renting a car or 4WD vehicle is strongly recommended, though the compact downtown area is walkable.

weather.description: Cold winter days with occasional snow and freezing nights, but often sunny and clear.
Still cold with possible snow, though sunny spells make daytime hiking pleasant.
Warming temperatures and longer days make this a popular early-season hiking month.
One of the best months to visit with mild temperatures, blooming desert flora, and low crowds.
Warm and dry with long daylight hours, ideal for outdoor adventures before summer heat arrives.
Hot and dry desert conditions; early morning starts are essential for any strenuous activity.
Intense heat with afternoon monsoon thunderstorms possible, making flash floods a real hazard.
Still very hot with continued monsoon activity; hike early and watch weather forecasts carefully.
Temperatures begin to ease and crowds thin, making this an excellent shoulder-season month.
Crisp autumn days with stunning red rock colors and comfortable hiking conditions.
Cool and quiet with occasional cold snaps; a peaceful time to explore with fewer visitors.
Cold winter weather returns with possible snow and icy trails, but clear skies are common.
